title: ظَنَّ وَأَخَوَاتُهَا
titleEn: Verbs of Thinking and Their Sisters
description: Learn about ظنّ وأخواتها, verbs that take two accusative objects (مفعولين), expressing thought, belief, certainty, or transformation.

notes.title: What are ظنّ وأخواتها?
content: ظنّ وأخواتها are verbs that take two objects in the accusative case (مفعولين). Originally, these two objects were a subject (مبتدأ) and predicate (خبر).
For example: الطَّالِبُ مُجْتَهِدٌ (The student is diligent) becomes ظَنَنْتُ الطَّالِبَ مُجْتَهِدًا (I thought the student diligent).
keyPoints: These verbs convert a nominal sentence into two accusative objects

examples.english: I knew the truth to be clear

notes.title: Verbs of Doubt and Supposition
content: These verbs express doubt, supposition, or probability. The main ones are: ظَنَّ (to think/suppose), حَسِبَ (to reckon/suppose), خَالَ (to imagine), زَعَمَ (to claim).
They indicate uncertainty or belief rather than confirmed knowledge.
keyPoints: ظَنَّ - يَظُنُّ: to think, suppose (most common)

examples.english: I thought the weather was cold
I imagined the matter was easy
They claimed he was a liar

notes.title: Verbs of Certainty
content: These verbs express certainty or confirmed knowledge. The main ones are: عَلِمَ (to know), رَأَى (to see/realize), وَجَدَ (to find), دَرَى (to know/be aware).
Note: رَأَى here means 'to realize/consider' (قلبية), not physical seeing (بصرية).
keyPoints: رَأَى - يَرَى: to realize, consider (not physical seeing)
دَرَى - يَدْرِي: to know, be aware

examples.english: I knew honesty to be salvation
I knew the news to be true

notes.title: Verbs of Transformation
content: Some grammarians include verbs of transformation (التصيير) in this category. These include: جَعَلَ (to make), صَيَّرَ (to turn into), اتَّخَذَ (to take as), تَرَكَ (to leave as).
These verbs show changing something from one state to another.

examples.english: Allah made the earth a cradle
The blacksmith turned the iron into a sword
I took him as a friend

exercises.promptEn: I knew the truth to be _____

exercises.prompt: I thought the weather was cold
I took him as a friend
